text: michael_dawson Walt , you got ta keep that dog quiet .
walt_lloyd I do n't know what 's wrong with him . Come on , Vincent , cut that out .
michael_dawson Sorry , hey , sorry , sorry .
kate_austen What is it ?
claire_littleton Somebody 's in there .
sayid_jarrah Everyone in there 's dead .
dr_jack_shephard Sawyer .
james_ford Right behind you , Jackass .
kate_austen Jack ?
james_ford I 'm gon na shed some light on this thing .
dr_jack_shephard Run .
hugo_reyes Oh crud , now what ?
sayid_jarrah They 're gone .
charlie_pace What the bloody hell was that ?
john_locke Boars .
dr_jack_shephard Those boars were looking to feed . We have to get rid of the bodies .
charlie_pace Bury them ? There 's a whole bunch in there .
sayid_jarrah More than twenty . Digging will be difficult without shovels .
dr_jack_shephard We 're not burying them . We need to burn them .
kate_austen They 're people .
dr_jack_shephard I know they 're people , Kate .
sayid_jarrah Burning the remains , they deserve better than that .

dr_jack_shephard Better than what ? Being eaten by wild animals ? Because that 's what 's going to happen . Any bodies we bury are not going to stay buried for very long . Look , I know this seems harsh , but that fuselage in the sun — it 's not about what they deserve . They 're gone , and we 're not .
sayid_jarrah What you say may be true , but for us to decide how these people are laid to rest — it 's not right . No regard for their wishes ? Their religions ?
dr_jack_shephard We do n't have time to sort out everybody 's god .
charlie_pace Really , last I heard we were positively made of time .

dr_jack_shephard Look , I 'm not happy about it either , but we crashed a thousand miles off course . They 're looking for us in the wrong place . It 's been 4 days , no one 's come . Tomorrow morning we need everyone to start gathering up wood , dried brush , and turn that fuselage into a furnace . Wait until the sun goes down tomorrow night before we start the fire .
charlie_pace If he 's so eager to burn the bodies why are we waiting until sundown ?
kate_austen He 's hoping someone will see it .
kate_austen Looks like I 'm not the only who could n't sleep last night .
sayid_jarrah There are better things to do with my time than collect firewood .
kate_austen You do n't agree with Jack . What are you making ?
sayid_jarrah Too soon to talk about . I 'm not sure it will even work .
kate_austen You 're trying to pick up the transmission are n't you ? The one we heard on the transceiver .
sayid_jarrah If the French woman 's transmission has truly been playing on a loop for 16 years then there must be a power source on the Island . A significant one .
kate_austen And you can find it ?

sayid_jarrah Hypothetically , yes . I 'm making an antenna of sorts . With a few of these mounted at different points on the Island I may be able to use the transceiver to triangulate the signal , find out where it 's coming from .
kate_austen So what can I do to help ?
sayid_jarrah It appears you are as anxious to get off this Island as I am .
walt_lloyd Catch the ball , catch the ball , Vincent . Good boy , good job Vincent .
michael_dawson Hey , hey , where you going , man ?
walt_lloyd Nowhere , I just thought I 'd see what Mr. Locke was doing .
michael_dawson Hey , why do n't you help your dad with the wood . I 'm sure Mr. Locke does n't want a kid hanging around him all day anyway .
walt_lloyd At least he talks to me . Come on , Vincent .
hugo_reyes What 's your problem ? Hand them over .
james_ford How about no ?
hugo_reyes There 's other people here or do n't you give a crap ?
james_ford Well if one of us would n't eat more than his fair share ... .
hugo_reyes Oh that 's bull and you know it . You 're not happy unless you 're screwing over everybody ... .
james_ford Hey I 'm peachy , pork pie .
dr_jack_shephard Guys , knock it off .
james_ford Stay out of this , Metro .
dr_jack_shephard What 's going on ?
hugo_reyes Jethro here 's hoarding the last of the peanuts .
james_ford My own stash . I found it in there .
dr_jack_shephard What about the rest of the food ?
hugo_reyes There is no rest of the food , dude . We kind of — ate it all .
shannon_rutherford What ?
dr_jack_shephard Okay everybody , just calm down .
sayid_jarrah We can find food . There are plenty of things on this Island we can use for sustenance .
james_ford And exactly how are we going to find this sustenance .
john_locke We hunt .
kate_austen How 'd you get that knife on the plane ?
john_locke Checked it .
dr_jack_shephard You either have very good aim , or very bad aim , Mr ... .
michael_dawson Locke . His name is Locke .
dr_jack_shephard Okay Mr. Locke , what is it that we 're hunting ?

john_locke We know there are wild boar on the Island . Razorbacks , by the look of them . The ones that came into the camp last night were piglets , 100 , 150 pounds each . Which means that there 's a mother nearby . A 250 pound rat , with scimitar - like tusks , and a surly disposition , who 'd love nothing more than to eviscerate anything that comes near . Boar 's usual mode of attack is to circle around and charge from behind so I figure it 'll take at least three of us to distract her long enough for me to flank one of the piglets , pin it , and slit its throat .
james_ford And you gave him his knife back ?
dr_jack_shephard Well , if you 've got a better idea .
james_ford Better than the three of you wandering into the magic forest to bag a hunk of ham with nothing but a little bitty hunting knife ? Hell no , it 's the best idea I ever heard .
hugo_reyes Who is this guy ?
john_locke Yes ?
GL12 Colonel Locke , is this line secure ?
john_locke Line secure GL12 , go ahead .
GL12 Target area is acquired . Maneuvers are a go for 1300 hours . Repeat we are a GO .
john_locke Roger that . We 'll convene at the usual rendezvous point at 1300 hours .
randy Locke . I told you I need those TPS reports done by noon today . Not 1230 ; not 1215 ; noon .
john_locke I heard you the first time , Randy .
randy And no personal calls during office hours , Colonel .
dr_jack_shephard So ? Hunting boar , now , huh ?
kate_austen Who says it 's my first time boar hunting ?
dr_jack_shephard Uh - huh . Tell me something , how come every time there 's a hike into the heart of darkness you sign up ? You know what 's in there .
kate_austen Actually , I do n't . And neither do you .
dr_jack_shephard What 's your feel on our new friend ?
kate_austen Seems to know what he 's doing .
dr_jack_shephard Call me paranoid , but anyone who packs a suitcase full of knives ?
kate_austen If I did n't know any better , I 'd say your worried about me , Jack .
dr_jack_shephard If I did n't know any better , I 'd say you have a problem staying in one place for very long , Kate . So , you want to tell me why you 're really going ?
kate_austen Sayid gave me this so he can triangulate the distress signal we heard — find the source .
dr_jack_shephard This is n't about boars .
kate_austen I 'm a vegetarian .
walt_lloyd But why ca n't I come ?
michael_dawson Because I said so .

michael_dawson Hi , hi , excuse me . Um , I am going off , away , to hunt , and um , I was wondering if you could keep an eye on my boy , Walt . And , I 'm Michael . Anyway , could you watch him for me , until I come back ?
sunhwa_kwon 아 ... . 아드님은 제가 잘 돌보고 있을게요. 예 ... .
michael_dawson Sorry I do n't understand , but you 're cool with this , right ?
walt_lloyd I do n't need a babysitter .
michael_dawson Come on , Vincent needs you here . And , hey , cheer up . This will give me a chance to get to know your friend Mr. Locke a little better .
sunhwa_kwon 너무 걱정하지 마. 아버지 괜찮으실 거야.
walt_lloyd Yeah , whatever .
claire_littleton Excuse me . Doctor ?
dr_jack_shephard Claire , right ? How 's the .

claire_littleton Oh , he 's good , yeah , thanks . Um , I thought maybe you should see this . Someone found it in there . They 're collecting all the belongings . They 're wedding plans for Steve and Kristin . They were on the plane sitting a couple of rows behind me . I remember because they looked so happy .
dr_jack_shephard I do n't understand , Claire , what am I supposed to do with this ?
claire_littleton Oh , well , um , some of us were wondering if maybe we should do some kind of memorial service , or something . You could lead it .
dr_jack_shephard Uh , no , I do n't think it ... .
claire_littleton Well , you know , just a few words , or we could just read their names from passports , and drivers ... .
dr_jack_shephard Look , it 's not my thing .
claire_littleton Oh , okay . Maybe I 'll do it .
dr_jack_shephard Yeah , sounds fine . Whatever everybody wants .
boone_carlyle That woman 's still sitting there .
shannon_rutherford Mmmhmmm .
boone_carlyle Her husband was on the plane .
shannon_rutherford Right .
boone_carlyle Are you even listening to me ?
shannon_rutherford What 's a four letter word for I do n't care ?
boone_carlyle I just think somebody should go talk to her .
shannon_rutherford I nominate you , Captain America . You just ca n't help yourself , can you ?
boone_carlyle Yeah , well , at least you do n't have to worry about starving with me taking care of you .
shannon_rutherford I 'm not going to starve .
boone_carlyle Right , what are you going to eat ?
shannon_rutherford The ocean 's full of fish .
boone_carlyle I hate to break it to you — the ocean is not going to take your gold card .
shannon_rutherford You really do n't think I ca n't catch a fish ?
kate_austen You find something ?

john_locke The ground here has been rooted up . That 's how boars get the majority of their food , they dig . Afterwards they generally wallow in the dirt , rub up against the trees , scoring them with their tusks .
michael_dawson Okay . So what 's all that mean ?
john_locke Means we 're close .
shannon_rutherford Hi .
charlie_pace Hi . ( putting the drugs back in his pocket ) . Shannon , right ?
shannon_rutherford Yeah . Are you doing anything ?
charlie_pace Me ? No , I was just , uh . What are you doing ?
shannon_rutherford I was just going to go for a walk . Do you want to come ?
charlie_pace Yeah , yes , sure .
shannon_rutherford Can I ask you something ?
charlie_pace Oh , I wondered when this was going to come up . Yes , I 'm the bass guitarist in Dri … .
shannon_rutherford Do you know anything about fishing ?

charlie_pace What ? Fishing ? My grand - dad used to take me out , taught me everything he knows . Everything he knew , he 's dead now , god rest his soul . Yeah , I 'm like a … I 'm a fishing fiend . I mean England 's an island so I just throw it in and … fish .
shannon_rutherford Good .
boone_carlyle Hey doc , you got a second ?
dr_jack_shephard What 's up ?

boone_carlyle The woman 's been sitting over there by herself . Maybe she 's having trouble dealing with her husband ? I do n't think she 's had anything to eat or drink . Think maybe you can go talk to her ?
dr_jack_shephard Why me ? I 'm not a psychiatrist . I mean , maybe you should ... .
boone_carlyle I just thought you might want to do it . You 're the one that saved her life .

dr_jack_shephard Hi . Rose , right ? Remember me , seat 23A ? I 'm the guy that told you not to worry about the turbulence . Everybody 's getting pretty worried about you , Rose . If you want to be alone that 's fine , but you have to take care of yourself . You should really drink . Okay . We do n't have to talk . Let 's just sit for a while .
kate_austen Your son , how 's he handling all of this ?
michael_dawson A hell of a lot better than I am .
kate_austen You must be proud . He 's a brave kid .
michael_dawson Yeah . I ca n't take credit for that . I was n't part of his life . Till his mother passed away , two weeks ago .
kate_austen I 'm sorry . I did n't know .
michael_dawson That 's okay . There were living in Sydney the past couple of years . I flew out last week , you know , to go get him . What were you doing in Australia ?
john_locke Shhh .
michael_dawson Hey , quit giving us the steal signal .
kate_austen He 's bad .
GL12 Move . You 've got to move Col . Your troops are across enemy lines .
john_locke Patience , the quality which you lack , GL12 , is the hallmark of a leader .

randy Hallmark , huh ? Tell me more about being a leader , Locke . While you 're at it , tell me about this Col . thing . I cruised your file in human resources , you 've never been in any of the armed forces .
john_locke I 'm just playing a game , Randy . It 's my lunch hour , I can play a game .
randy Well , tell me , what 's a Walkabout ? """" Experience the dream journeys of the fabled Australian Outback . """" .
john_locke You have no right taking that off my desk .
randy So , you wander around hunting and gathering food , right ? On foot ?

john_locke Not that you would understand , but a Walkabout is a journey of spiritual renewal , where one derives strength from the earth . And becomes inseparable from it . I have vacation days , I 'm going , Randy . I 've already made a reservation .
GL12 Wow . John you 're really doing it , huh ? You tell Helen yet ?
randy Helen ? Well , what 's this Locke , you 've actually got a woman in your life .
john_locke That 's none of your business .
randy What is it with you Locke ? Why do you torture yourself ? I mean , imagining you 're some hunter ? Walkabouts ? Wake up , you ca n't do any of that .
john_locke Norman Croucher .
randy What ? Norman what ?
john_locke Norman Croucher . Norman Croucher , double amputee , no legs . He climbed to the top of Mt. Everest . Why ? It was his destiny .
randy That 's what you think you 've got , old man ? Destiny ?
john_locke Just do n't tell me what I ca n't do .
kate_austen He 's hurt . John ? Can you hear me ? Locke ? John you okay ?
kate_austen Locke ?
john_locke I 'm fine , I 'm fine . I 'm fine , Helen , I just got the wind knocked out of me is all .
kate_austen Helen ?
john_locke What ?
kate_austen You called me Helen .
john_locke Did I ?
john_locke Which way did that boar go ?
kate_austen Michael 's hurt . We have to get him back to camp .
john_locke Yeah , you take him back to camp . I 'm going to get that boar .
kate_austen What are you talking about ?
john_locke I 'm fine . I can do this .
kate_austen John , you ca n't .
john_locke Do n't tell me what I ca n't do .
charlie_pace Did you get it ?
hugo_reyes Dude , quit asking me that .
charlie_pace Sorry . You , you said you knew how to fish .
hugo_reyes Yeah , off the Santa Monica pier with my old man and a fishing pole and bait . Never had to try and poke one with a sharp stick .
charlie_pace Well , I really appreciate you helping me out , thanks .
hugo_reyes Anything to keep me far away from that fuselage and that freakin ' redneck jerk . Damn it , crap , crap , son of a ... .
charlie_pace You let me have a go ?
hugo_reyes Knock yourself out . Okay , here comes one . Put your weight into it . Now , you see it ? Wait for it , wait ... now . . Dude , you 've got to try to pin it .
charlie_pace You see how close I was ? No , you said I had to corner it .
claire_littleton Excuse me , your name 's Sayid , right ?
sayid_jarrah Yes .
claire_littleton I just found this . It 's got your name on it . .
sayid_jarrah I thought I 'd lost this . Thank you .
claire_littleton Sure .
rose_nadler His fingers swell .
dr_jack_shephard Sorry ?
rose_nadler Bernard , my husband , his hands swell up whenever we fly .
dr_jack_shephard The altitude .

rose_nadler He started having me hold onto his wedding ring whenever we took a plane trip . Always wore it around my neck for safe keeping . Just until we landed . You know , doctor , you do n't have to keep your promise .
dr_jack_shephard Promise ?
rose_nadler The one you gave me on the plane . The one you made me — to keep me company until my husband got back from the restroom . I 'm letting you off the hook .
dr_jack_shephard Well , you 're not going to get rid of me that easily . Rose , you should n't be out here alone . You 're suffering from Post Traumatic Shock .
rose_nadler Are n't we all ?
dr_jack_shephard Yeah , I guess we are .
rose_nadler You have a nice way about you . A good soul , patient , caring . I suppose that 's why you became a doctor .
dr_jack_shephard Thanks but I was just kind of born into it . Family business .

john_locke I have never felt so alive . Getting to finally tell Randy off was ... life changing . I mean it , now I 'm free to do all those things I ever wanted to do . Things that I know I was destined to do , like we talked about Helen .
helen_norwood That 's wonderful John . I 'm happy for you , really .
john_locke I have n't even told you the best part . You remember the authentic aboriginal Walkabout ?
helen_norwood Sure . That 's all you 've talked about for weeks .
john_locke Yeah , well , I 'm going to do it . I 'm flying to Australia at the end of the week . And I 've , uh . I bought two tickets . Helen ?
helen_norwood John , we 've talked about this . I like you and I 've enjoyed talking with you these past few months .
john_locke 8 months .
helen_norwood I 'm not allowed to meet customers .
john_locke Customer ? Is that what I am to you ?
helen_norwood This is n't really normal . I mean , it is n't what I do . I do n't know , maybe you should find a ... I do n't know ... a therapist ?
john_locke I have a therapist .
helen_norwood John .
john_locke I thought you understood Helen . You know me better than anyone .
helen_norwood John , if we talk any longer , I 'm going to have to charge you for another hour . That 's another 89.95 and ... .
john_locke Look , I do n't care about the money . I just ... .
helen_norwood I 'm sorry John , I 've got to go .
john_locke Helen , Helen . Helen !
kate_austen Hey , hey wait a minute . Rest here for a minute .
michael_dawson I thought the guy with the gimpy leg should be deciding when we rest . What are you doing ?
kate_austen Trying to boost the transceiver signal . I 'm going to climb this tree and attach the antenna .
michael_dawson You 're going to climb that ?
kate_austen Yeah . Do n't worry . I 've climbed a lot worse .
kate_austen Locke .
james_ford Hey , uh ... .
claire_littleton Hey .
james_ford These were , um . I found these the other day when I was ... Aw hell , just , just take it .
claire_littleton Thank you .

walt_lloyd Oh , I get it . It 's like toothpaste .

walt_lloyd Chia ?

hugo_reyes So , like , what happened out there ?
walt_lloyd Dad !
michael_dawson Hey , hey !
walt_lloyd Your leg 's all messed up . Does it hurt ?
michael_dawson It 's okay . It 's not as bad as it looks .
james_ford The mighty huntress returns . What 's for dinner , hon- .
kate_austen Not now .
walt_lloyd So , it was like a boar fight ?
michael_dawson Not too much of a fight . It was more like me getting gored .
walt_lloyd So , um , where 's Mr. Locke ?
boone_carlyle I do n't think that hunt went very well . The bald guy never came back .
shannon_rutherford Wait , they did n't bring back any food at all ?
boone_carlyle Did you hear what I just said ? Somebody might have died out there .
shannon_rutherford Well , we 're all going to die if somebody does n't do something .
charlie_pace There you are . As promised , you and I will be dining of fresh catch of the day .
shannon_rutherford Oh , my fish !
charlie_pace I hope you do n't mind al fresco . It was no problem . You know what , that one actually gave me a hell of a tussle , but you have to get inside the mind of the fish , you know .
boone_carlyle I do n't believe you .
charlie_pace I got it in the shallows , I cornered it .
shannon_rutherford What 's the matter ? Ca n't stand to see me fending for myself ?
boone_carlyle I 'm sorry about this , seriously .
charlie_pace No , no , it 's okay .
shannon_rutherford What are you apologizing to him for ?
boone_carlyle For you . For using him — using this poor guy like you use everyone else .
shannon_rutherford Oh , whatever .
boone_carlyle Somewhere in that twisted little brain , you think this proves that you can take care of yourself .
shannon_rutherford I told you I 'd catch a fish , did n't I ?
boone_carlyle That 's low Shannon , even for you .
shannon_rutherford Oh , go rescue a baby bird or something .

dr_jack_shephard Rose , after the sun goes down , we 're going to burn the fuselage . It 's just something that we have to do . There 's going to be a memorial service back at the camp for those — for those who did n't make it . For everyone to say goodbye .
rose_nadler I 'd like to be there for that .
dr_jack_shephard Okay . . Maybe if you 'd like to say something , you know , about your husband .
rose_nadler What ?
dr_jack_shephard I 'm just saying if you wanted to say goodbye to Bernard .
rose_nadler Doctor , my husband is not dead .
dr_jack_shephard Rose , he was in the tail section of the plane . It broke off in mid - flight . I 'm sorry , but everyone who was in the rear of the plane 's gone .
rose_nadler They 're probably thinking the same thing about us .
rose_nadler Doctor ? You coming ?
kate_austen I 'm sorry . I guess I should 've gotten a warranty .

kate_austen Sayid , I 'll try it again .
sayid_jarrah We 'll try it again .
dr_jack_shephard Kate .
sayid_jarrah Excuse me .
kate_austen Hey .
dr_jack_shephard You okay ?

dr_jack_shephard No , I 'm not big on rubbing it in .
kate_austen Locke , um . Locke 's gone . That thing , it was moving in his direction . There was n't time . What 's going on ?
dr_jack_shephard The fuselage is ready to go . Some of the others decided , um … I guess there 's going to be some words said over the fire ... .
kate_austen That 's good .
dr_jack_shephard ... names read , I think .
kate_austen I just do n't think they 're ready to hear about some of the things that we 've ... .
kate_austen Jack ? Jack ?
dr_jack_shephard Locke .

claire_littleton Judith Martha Wexler from Denton , TX , guess she was going to catch a connecting flight . Um , she wore corrective lenses and she was an organ donor , or at least would have been . Steve and Kirsten , I do n't know their last name , but they were really in love and were going to be married . At least , wherever they are now , they 're not alone .
claire_littleton ... video store receipt lists his overdue charges for Willie Wonka and A Little Princess . Looks like he had n't traveled much ... as far as I can tell from his passport .
kate_austen You seen Jack ?
claire_littleton ... Wollstein , Harold , seat 23C.
claire_littleton That 's all we have on Harold , his name on a boarding pass ... I just wish there was something more ... Goodbye , Harold .
michael_dawson Nice work .
john_locke What ?
claire_littleton Millicent Louise D'Agostino .
michael_dawson The boar . Nice work , you know , killing it .
claire_littleton ... Teaneck , NJ .
michael_dawson Just thought I should say something . So that thing , the monster , whatever . She said it was headed right towards you . Did you see anything ? Get any kind of look at it ?
john_locke No .
travel_agent The Walkabouts we arrange here are not just some stroll through the park . It 's trekking across vast stretches of desert , rafting bloody treacherous waters .
john_locke Look , you 've got no idea who you 're talking to . I 'm well aware of what 's involved , believe me . I probably know more than you on the subject .
travel_agent In any case , it 's a trying ordeal for someone in peak physical condition , let alone ... .
john_locke Look , I booked this tour a month ago , you 've already got my money . Now , I demand a place on that bus .
travel_agent You misrepresented yourself ... .
john_locke I never lied .
travel_agent By omission , Mr. Locke . You neglected to tell us about your condition .
john_locke My condition is not an issue . I 've lived with it for 4 years . It 's never kept me from doing anything .
travel_agent Look , unfortunately it is an issue for our insurance company . I ca n't keep the bus waiting any longer . It is n't fair to the other people .
john_locke Hey , do n't talk to me about fair .
travel_agent I can get you on a plane back to Sydney on our dime . That 's the best I can do .
john_locke No . I do n't want to go back to Sydney . Look I 've been preparing for this for years . Just put me on the bus , right now , I can do this .
travel_agent No , you ca n't .

john_locke Hey , hey , do n't you walk away from me . . You do n't know who you 're dealing with . Do n't ever tell me what I ca n't do , ever . This is destiny . This is destiny . This is my destiny . ( yelling ) I 'm supposed to do this , dammit . Do n't tell me what I ca n't do . Do n't tell me what I ca n't ... .
claire_littleton Millicent Louise D'Agostino . Teaneck , New Jersey .
